Description: Floor and flaring ring foot with convex resting surface of Attic black-glazed pottery bolsal; concave lower part of wall with offset at junction of upper part; interior, exterior and foot glazed; reserved underside with reddish miltos wash, and dot, circle and band in glaze; inscription cut on underside (trademark).
Curator's comments: Excavated in the cemetery during the second season at Naukratis, 1885-1886.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 20)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1424)
